title: Fraktur font
content:
I always find it hard to identify fraktur fonts.  
Can anyone help?

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [incas.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906214154/http:/typophile.com/files/incas.gif) | 12.57 KB |

 [‹ Old Qantas Logo Font?](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906214154/http:/www.typophile.com/node/40911 "Go to previous forum topic") [Design Can Change Font ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906214154/http:/www.typophile.com/node/40942 "Go to next forum topic")
author: antofa

comments.content:
Hi Andrea,

this is a ‘Kanzlei’. Unfortunately, I don’t know if there’s a digital version that is a perfect match.  
Closest I found are [Kanzlei Light](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906214154/http:/www.moorstation.org/typoasis/designers/steffmann/samples/k/kanzlei.htm) and [Fette Kanzlei](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906214154/http:/www.moorstation.org/typoasis/designers/steffmann/samples/f/fettekanz.htm), both provided by [Dieter Steffmann](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906214154/http:/www.typophile.com/wiki/Dieter%252BSteffmann).  
F
